title: La Montagne 2013 Clone 4A Kessler-Haak Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a balsamic fig sauce touch to the nose of this clonal study, along with earthy soil, wild mint, iron and cherry. The flavors are very earthy and somewhat rustic as well, with touches of olive, sandalwood and dark red fruits.

title: L'Angolo 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This wine's toasty aromas seem slightly burnt, and that smoky note carries onto the palate. Its strawberry flavors seem to quickly hit a wall, suggesting it may still be a bit shocked.

title: Milestii Mici 2005 Merlot (Moldova)
description: This Moldovan Merlot carries aromas of black raspberry, vanilla and fresh red cherries. The smooth palate is balanced, with flavors of black raspberry and black cherry.

title: Morgadío 2016 Legado del Conde Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Stone fruit and floral aromas are friendly on the nose but not complex. This second-label bottling from Morgadío is round and nicely textured, while nectarine flavors lead to a healthy finish that stays the course.

title: Naveran 2014 Dama Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: A gold luster and a constant flow of beaded bubbles are encouraging signs. This Chardonnay-heavy brut shows apple and light brioche aromas, followed by a round palate. Salty melon and papaya flavors end with little fruit and a note of sourdough bread.

title: Naveran 2015 Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Solid apple cider and lime aromas are slightly briny on the nose. This brut shows freshness and tension on the palate, while citrusy flavors include green-herb notes. A slight bitterness rises up on a firm finish.

title: Owen Roe 2015 The Parting Glass Late Harvest Riesling (Yakima Valley)
description: Petrol, brown sugar, dried orange peel and light oxidative aromas lead to elegant but sweet stone and tropical fruit flavors in this wine. It's enjoyable on the palate, but the aromas don't come together.

title: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This powerful dry wine smells lightly earthy with lots of black cherry. It tastes rather taut and reserved due to very firm tannins and acidity, and has deep blackberry fruit underneath it all. It's very enjoyable in a dry style and will be great with food.

title: Penner-Ash 2015 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This wine's rather light wild berry flavors come with sour plum and green herb notes. The acids have a citrusy note and contribute a bit of chalk to the finish.

title: Penner-Ash 2015 Zena Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: One of several single vineyard offerings, this does not live up to the previous vintage. Here, the blackberry fruit feels a bit thin, with citrus and dried leaf notes and a chalky finish.

title: Rijckaert 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Mâcon-Burgy)
description: This is a ripe wine, full of tropical fruit as well as a lightly oxidative character from lees aging. It is softly textured, packed with fruit offering juicy acidity. Drink this wine from late 2018.

title: Rubinelli Vajol 2014  Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso
description: You'll discover underbrush, tobacco and black-skinned berry aromas on this full-bodied red. The structured palate shows ripe black cherry, cinnamon and a hint of licorice alongside supple tannins. Enjoy through 2021.

title: Sanctuary 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Sourced from Dutton Ranches and Heintz Vineyard, this wine employs a hearty helping of oak, which supports a core of juicy pear and pineapple. With additional richness from secondary elements of crème brûlée and coconut flakes, it finishes boldly ripe and full bodied.

title: Seguin-Manuel 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: This juicy wine is replete with red-berry and crisper red-currant flavors. Along with its bright character, the tannins and dry structure promise aging potential. Drink from 2021.

title: Seven Falls 2016 GPS Shaw Vineyard Chardonnay (Wahluke Slope)
description: It's rare to see a vineyard-designated Chardonnay come out of this appellation. This one brings light baking spice and apple aromas that lead to creamy-feeling stone fruit flavors. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.

title: Sokol Blosser 2016 Evolution Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: It would be hard to beat this wine at this price. Its sharp lime skin, lemon, apple and green melon flavors put the fruit front and center, with a barely perceptible touch of residual sugar. Though made entirely in stainless steel, it feels nicely rounded out, finishing with a hint of caramel.

title: Somlói Vándor 2015 Juhfark (Nagy-Somló)
description: Aromas of vanilla and apple lead to flavors of caramelized pineapple on the palate. A strong, mineral-driven backbone helps maintain a crisp, clean finish.

title: Spindrift Cellars 2015 Bovine Vineyards Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine's light strawberry and raspberry flavors show even lighter touches of new oak and skin contact. The aromas are quite pretty and suggest it will improve over the next five or six years.

title: Vincent Lumpp 2014 Clos Saint-Paul Premier Cru  (Givry)
description: Red-cherry aromas lead to a ripe, fruity and spicy wine. With red-berry fruits, juicy acidity and a crisp texture, this wine is almost ready to drink but the acidity needs to soften for a few more months. Drink from late 2018.

title: Yves Giroux 2015 Vers Chanes  (Mâcon-Fuissé)
description: A tangy wine with an edge of minerality, this is ripe while also having a tight texture. It is concentrated, full of yellow and white stone fruits that are balanced by acidity and a firm texture. That suggests the wine will age, so drink from mid 2018.

title: Zoetic Wines 2015 Block 21 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a block within the Hop Kiln Vineyard, this is made from 100% Pommard Clone grapes. Earthy in compost-like rusticity, it's intense in whole cluster-like spiciness, with a soft nose of rose petal and pomegranate.

title: A16 2013 Apogeo Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This wine's oaky nose includes a stand-out scent of maple. Its full, saturated palate feels a bit overdone, with toasty, chocolaty black fruit flavors. Mocha and coffee notes dominate the finish.

title: Airfield Estates 2014 Mustang Red (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is a blend of Syrah (65%), Grenache (20%) and Mourvèdre. While the aromas are locked up on first pour, it shows light raspberry, herb and spice notes as it opens. The flavors are soft and supple, with a pleasing mouthfeel.

title: Alain Gras 2015  Saint-Romain
description: Saint-Romain is one of the villages in the hills behind the main Côte de Beaune vineyards. As such it produces a cooler style of wine with crisp red-berry and red-currant fruitiness. There is a tang to its texture as well as a layer of tannins. Drink this potentially lively, fruity wine from 2019.

title: Altocedro 2016 Año Cero Malbec (La Consulta)
description: This wine's saucy plum and berry aromas are oaky but not overripe. It offers a round, resiny palate, with earthy, oak-laden berry flavors. Its fresh but saucy finish is a continuation of what came before.

title: Anonymous 2013 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Merlot and Zinfandel into a brawny, decadent whole. Juicy in blackberry, it is softly approachable and robust in brown sugar and chocolate.

title: Avancia 2016 Cuveé de O Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Mild but focused aromas of apple and lime are fresh and slightly minerally. This is round and easy on the palate, with controlled citric acidity. A simple flavor of orange finishes favorably but without complexity.

title: Aymara 2015 Reserva Barrel Selection Red (Mendoza)
description: Lightly herbal, earthy aromas of rubber and black fruits set this up for a lively palate. It's a blend of Malbec and Cabernets Sauvignon and Franc that tastes of dark berry fruits, spice and a vague earthiness that reflects the nose. On the finish, it's the dry tannins that last.

title: Conclusion 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: Oaky and reduced, this wine offers ripe black cherry, cola and subtle spice, with a streak of watermelon-fresh acidity. Medium-bodied, it reveals an underlying earthiness under the toasty oak.

title: Corte Rugolin 2016  Valpolicella Classico
description: This boasts aromas of ripe strawberry, violet and a touch of eucalyptus. The light-bodied, juicy palate offers raspberry jam, cinnamon and red cherry alongside fresh acidity and smooth tannins. Enjoy through 2019.
